formula: a(n) =2*a(ceiling[(n+1)/2])+A010060(n-1). If 3*2^(k-1) < n <= 2^(k+1), a(n)=2^(k+1)-1-a(n-2^k); if 2^(k+1) < n <= 3*2^k, a(n)=a(n-2^k)+2^k.a(n) = n XOR [n/2] XOR [n/4] XOR [n/8] ... XOR [n/2^m] where m = [log(n)/log(2)] (for n>0) and [x] is integer floor of x. - _Paul D. Hanna_, Jun 04 2002a(n) XOR [a(n)/2] = n. [_Paul D. Hanna_, Jan 18 2012]A066194(n) = a(n-1) + 1, n>=1 . - _Philippe Deléham_, Apr 29 2005Inverse of sequence A003188 . - _Philippe Deléham_, Apr 29 2005a(n) = if n<2 then n else 2*m + (n mod 2 + m mod 2) mod 2, with m=a(floor(n/2)).
